title: Bug 17825 ControlExampleText beeps when I choose SWT.MULTI
description: The bug report highlights that ControlExampleText produces unexpected beeping sounds when selecting SWT.MULTI, and it also mentions that clicking on other buttons triggers the same sound.
OB: When choosing SWT.MULTI in ControlExampleText, it produces beeping sounds, and the issue persists when clicking on other buttons.
EB: The expected behavior is that selecting SWT.MULTI should not result in any beeping sounds. The application should function without any audible alerts.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Use Build F1 (20020521) on Win2K. 
2. Access the SWT example ControlExample. 
3. Navigate to the Text tab. 
4. Click on the Styles SWT.SINGLE and then switch back to Styles SWT.MULTI. This should trigger the problem.
